image.altText: A man stands in front of Australian flags

props.synopsis: Staff at the notorious Unit 18 juvenile wing inside Perth's Casuarina maximum-security adult prison were watching movies or resting the night 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd was found unresponsive. WARNING: The story contains details of self-harm.

title.children: Minister reveals prison staff were watching movies as Cleveland Dodd cried out for help

image.altText: An island with white sandy beaches, turquoise water, swaying palms and blue sky.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced a new pact with the low-lying island country of Tuvalu, allowing residents facing displacement from climate change the ability resettle in Australia.

title.children: Tuvalu residents able to resettle in Australia as climate change 'threatens its existence'

image.altText: Actor Johnny Ruffo

props.synopsis: The star had been diagnosed with brain cancer for a second time, and was surrounded by his partner and family when he died, a message posted on Instagram says.

title.children: Johnny Ruffo, former Home and Away actor, dies from brain cancer aged 35

image.altText: A young man sits in a chair with bandages to his arm and head, there's dried blood dripping from his head onto his chest

props.synopsis: The Children's Court has heard a 16-year-old was released from a youth detention centre the day before he allegedly attacked and robbed taxi driver Yawinder Gill Singh.

title.children: Youth involved in alleged stabbing of Bunbury taxi driver released from Banksia Hill the day before

image.altText: A group of customers surround a retail worker inside of a shop

props.synopsis: First the hack, then the outage. Many customers want out of Optus, while others want compensation. Here's a look at your consumer rights.

title.children: Did you lose money because of the Optus outage? Here's how to try and get it back

image.altText: man with arms crossed stands in front of sign pointing toward hospital entrance

props.synopsis: A $20 million redevelopment of Laverton Hospital in WA's northern Goldfields remains in limbo, amid concerns the cost of the project has blown out.

title.children: Shire president demands answers about WA town's $20m 'neglected' hospital rebuild

image.altText: A man carrying a baby with suitcases behind talking to another man amongst a crowd of people

props.synopsis: Israel has not yet officially confirmed a daily four-hour humanitarian pause, which the US says it agreed to, with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu saying safe passages for evacuation will be facilitated for "a few hours here or a few hours there".

title.children: Biden praises 'humanitarian pauses' in Gaza fighting, but Netanyahu declines to confirm 'stoppages' — as it happened

image.altText: Three astronauts wearing their spacesuits huddle

props.synopsis: Borman commanded Apollo 8's historic Christmas 1968 flight that circled the moon and paved the way for the 1969 lunar landing.

title.children: Apollo 8 astronaut Frank Borman, hailed as'one of NASA's best' dies aged 95

image.altText: A man sitting on an Indigenous child (face blurred) on grass, as another man moves his knee towards the child.

props.synopsis: A man filmed making threats and placing his foot on the head of an Indigenous child, while the suspended mayor of the Barkly council restrained the boy, will face court on a charge of aggravated assault.

title.children: Man charged with assault after 'citizen's arrest' of Indigenous child

image.altText: A woman shouts into a microphone in front of an assorted crowd holding SAG-AFTRA on Strike signs

props.synopsis: The longest-ever Hollywood writers-actors' strike has ended, but the union warns Australian studios are increasingly including clauses that will allow them to sell actors' voices and images to third parties.

title.children: Hollywood's strike has ended, but Australian actors are still fighting for the same protections

image.altText: Ambulance with lights on

props.synopsis: A 62-year-old woman has died after being crushed by a falling tree during a storm in the Lockyer Valley.

title.children: Woman dies after being crushed by falling tree during wild storms

image.altText: Am MCU of a middle-aged woman with spectacles and a striped shirt posing for a photo in front of plants.

props.synopsis: This single mother was heartbroken when Airbnbs took away affordable rentals in her seaside home and left her struggling to find somewhere stable to live. She hopes a new government incentive will ease the pressure.

title.children: Beck wants stable housing for her daughter but the spread of Airbnbs in her town makes that tough

image.altText: A police truck parked on a dirt track

props.synopsis: WA Police have found 14-year-old girl Bella Norris about 18 hours after she went missing from a Quondong camping site in the state's north.

title.children: Missing teen girl reunited with family after massive air, ground search

image.altText: A split image of a policeman, in police uniform and hat, on the left, and a suited man wearing sunglasses on the right.

props.synopsis: Six police officers who played a key role in the investigation into the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins want to be included in a civil case challenging the outcome of an inquiry into former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Police officers apply to join civil case challenging outcome of inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution

image.altText: A woman who was found dead in a Brisbane park

props.synopsis: The man responsible for the death of 26-year-old Ioli Hadjilyra, whose body was found in a garden bed in northern Brisbane, could be released from prison before Christmas.

title.children: Man responsible for death of 26-year-old woman in Brisbane eligible for parole in just weeks

image.altText: A blonde woman holding her hat shakes the hand of an older man with white hair. Behind them are many other people.

props.synopsis: After eight weeks of evidence, across the past six months, Northern Territory Coroner Elisabeth Armitage has adjourned her landmark inquiry into the NT's domestic, family and sexual violence system.

title.children: 'Her life still matters': NT domestic violence inquiry wraps up after six months

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: A man in immigration detention who had served a prison sentence for child sexual offences re-enters the community, with the government confirming dozens of others who were wrongly detained will soon follow.

title.children: Government confirms dozens held in indefinite detention will be released, as wrongly detained man re-enters community

image.altText: A nicobar pigeon

props.synopsis: Usually found in South East Asia, the colourfully plumed Nicobar pigeon has been spotted living its "best life" on Green Island off the coast of Cairns, delighting tourist and puzzling scientists.

title.children: Dodo relative's mysterious appearance on tropical island baffles bird experts

image.altText: Netflix

props.synopsis: Continual price hikes and fragmentation of services have seen some Australians ditch their streaming services in favour of film and TV piracy.

title.children: Streaming costs are rising, and there are more platforms than ever to choose between. Some people are going back to piracy

image.altText: Closeup of a plane with a red kangaroo symbol, the Qantas logo

props.synopsis: WA's tourism minister and local tourism operators are disappointed in the decision by Qantas to discontinue direct flights between Exmouth and Melbourne from 2024.

title.children: Tourism businesses stunned as Qantas cuts Melbourne-Exmouth direct flights

image.altText: A hand holding a purple vape, Bunbury tower in the background

props.synopsis: Without a prescription, the retail purchase of e-cigarettes is not allowed in Western Australia. But in at least one regional city, they're being sold without question.

title.children: They're meant to be illegal but in Bunbury, vapes are being sold like lollies

image.altText: A team of paramedics carrying a woman along the beach away from the water.

props.synopsis: A woman has been taken to hospital after being attacked by a shark at Port Noarlunga Jetty, south of Adelaide.

title.children: Woman attacked by shark at beach in Adelaide's south

image.altText: Scars from a mastectomy

props.synopsis: When Melanie Law's life depended on having her breasts removed, her appearance was the least of her concerns. But strangers and even health professionals saw it as an issue.

title.children: Melanie's life depended on having her breasts removed. When she chose to stay flat-chested, she was asked what her 'husband thought'

image.altText: The exterior of Casuarina Prison in Western Australia

props.synopsis: The juvenile detention system in WA has hit rock bottom, but there were some signs of optimism when a young offender was sentenced for his crimes, writes state political reporter Keane Bourke.

title.children: A glimpse inside the notorious Unit 18 offers signs of hope for WA's youth detention system

image.altText: A man floats in the ocean in a life raft.

props.synopsis: Paramedics say it's incredible no one was hurt after two people were winched from a life raft after a light plane crash off the Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Video shows moment two men are saved from sinking life raft after plane crash off Sunshine Coast

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Floral tribute with message 'you were not invisible, you will not be forgotten! With much love' placed outside community centre.

props.synopsis: Jurors in the murder trial of a man who fatally bashed a homeless person in Tweed Heads hear the chilling and bizarre interviews he gave to police after his arrest.

title.children: 'I created, destroyed and now that's it': Jury hears man who confessed to killing two men considered his crimes 'art'

image.altText: Business people walk past a shiny black sign that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank reveals the reasoning behind its latest interest rate rise and whether it is likely to have to lift them again.

title.children: Businesses aren't cutting prices fast enough and record migration is one reason why, according to the RBA

image.altText: A man inside a ship, wearing a big coat, and looking out to see

props.synopsis: Partisans in Crimea claim they provided critical intelligence to Ukraine's armed forces about Russia's Black Sea navy headquarters before it was destroyed by a missile attack in September.

title.children: Russia took this part of Ukraine — it's now facing a new enemy inside the occupied territory

image.altText: An elderly man sitting behind a table with a vintage chair in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The NSW pricing regulator has released a final report into its rate peg review. It comes as rising rates add to the cost of living crisis.

title.children: Could you feed yourself on $9 a day? A pensioner says that's all he can afford due to rising rates

image.altText: flowers and pictures with candles

props.synopsis: Friends and family of the five people killed in a horror pub crash in Daylesford call for ongoing support as they give tearful tributes to their loved ones.

title.children: Outpouring of grief in Melbourne's west for Daylesford victims

image.altText: A heat map of the Earth on July 11, 2023.

props.synopsis: Between November 2022 and October this year, the average global temperature was more than 1.3 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, and more record highs are on the way.

title.children: Hottest 12 months in probably 125,000 years, with El Niño only just getting started

image.altText: A man stands amid Kimberley red rock formations

props.synopsis: As the WA government faces a barrage of criticism over youth justice, Indigenous leaders in the East Kimberley are pushing the case for a so-called cultural sentencing trek, arguing a new approach is desperately needed.

title.children: East Kimberley leaders push for sentencing trek amid growing criticism of youth justice system
